numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that the graph is a stacked scatter plot.
2. The plot consists of participants from 7 African countries.
3. The plot consists of participants from 6 Asian countries.
4. The plot consists of participants from 4 American countries.
5. The plot consists of participants from 4 European countries.
6. The survey is fairly distributed with respect to diversity.
7. The survey concerns aspirations about generations bettering the world over time.
8. I noticed that the survey has few participants who are older than 40 years.
9. I perceive this lack as a sign.
10. I think that the opinions of people who are older than 40 years are less significant for this topic.
11. I think that the generation of people who are older than 40 years has passed.
12. I believe that participants who are between 15 years and 24 years are more reliable in this survey.
13. I think that participants who are between 15 years and 24 years are the current generation.
14. I think that participants who are between 15 years and 24 years still have time to take new steps to better the world.
15. I am fascinated by the survey.
16. I wonder how people respond to the question in the survey.
17. I ask what the criteria of better are.
18. I ask whether the environment of a person affects how the person perceives the world.
19. Because of this, I think that the graph is unreliable.
20. These countries are in different circumstances.
21. Some circumstances concern GDP.
22. Some circumstances concern environment.
23. Some circumstances concern health.
24. Some circumstances concern safety.
25. Therefore, I think that better is biased.
26. I think that different standards are incompatible.
27. I am a citizen of Burundi.
28. Burundi is the poorest country in the world.
29. My standards of better cannot be similar to the standards of a person from the USA.
30. The USA is one of the richest countries in the world.
31. A change that makes something better can benefit one person.
32. The same change can be a disadvantage for another person.
33. The headline is: IS THE FUTURE 'BETTER' FOR EVERYONE?
